Reviews.Content: Nice new rooms Having previously been to Florence further off season (Nov or Feb), our usual hotels were way pricier. We hence decided to stay a little further out. When we got there we were taken to the new rooms across the road from the main block. We were really surprised, there were large and modern, with a sofa, contemporary furniture and a large flat screen TV.Staff were friendly (apart from one, who after us making a little effort became extremely friendly as well).It's a little out of town but there were some amazing local restaurants around. To be honest though, we still walked in to town (and back in the end). We're in our early 30's... For the price, I'd really recommend the place.
Reviews.Author: paulwoodh

Reviews.Content: nice but far away from everything We stayed at the Best Western Select in Florence from Sept. 28 thru Oct. 2nd. It was a nice hotel, but you had to take a bus to see any attractions in Florence. The back of the hotel was next to a school so it was very loud in the day, but very quiet at night. The room was clean and the bathroom had lots of room. The lady who ran the breakfast room was a little rude. The front desk all spoke english and was helpful with the bus system. Great hotel if your alright with catching very crowded buses everyday.
Reviews.Author: tahoesun1

Reviews.Content: Nice hotel about 10 minutes from the Airport My family of 4 needed a hotel near the airport but still in Florence, as our flight left 7:15 a.m, but we still wanted to have a great last meal in Italy. The day before, the hotel let us drop off our main luggage and we went to Venice for 24 hours. Upon arriving back in Florence, we walked about 20 minutes from the train station, getting to the Hotel at about 10 p.m. The concierge kindly called and got us a late night reservation at a local and fantastic restaurant a few blocks away. He also arranged for an early (5:45 a.m.) taxi to the airport. The quad room was sort of small, but it was perfect for us our last night. We'd recommend the place for sure. We can't tell you about breakfast because we left too early! The staff was great.
Reviews.Author: PatSnyder

Reviews.Content: Good Hotel, Long Walk Large, clean rooms with rather large bathroom. A/C worked well and there was a little fridge, which was very useful. The bed felt bigger than typical European beds. The major problems were the noise on the street and the long walk from the main tourist sites. This is a great value if you don't mind the walk.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: A little disappointed Stayed at the Select from 5 - 9 June 2006We took a taxi to the Select from the station for under 鈧?8 and it took less than 10 minutes. Although the hotel was a little further than we would have liked it to be from the town centre, it turned out not to be as big a deal as we originally thought it would be. A number 22 bus has a stop not far from the hotel and the service is frequent and cost 鈧?1 and tickets are available form the hotel reception. Although the staff didn鈥檛 go out of their way to make conversation, they were polite and helpful when asked for assistance. As usual you are a little apprehensive when you are about to open the door of the room you will call home for the next number of days and wonder if its up to your expectations, having been caught out before, the concern is always there.The room we stayed in was reasonably decorated and although we couldn鈥檛 initially put our finger on what we didn鈥檛 like about the bedroom, I think it was the darker base colour on the walls, dark carpet and the dark furniture to match an old window frame. There is a children鈥檚 playschool at the rear of the room we were in (118) and although as you would expect they were noisy, it didn鈥檛 bother us, as we weren鈥檛 there during the day. The bathroom was well appointed, as was the decor in the parts of the hotel we saw. However, breakfast was poor and basically bread and cheese and ham. My biggest disappointment was the fact that there was no bar that you could sit and unwind in after you had tramped the streets all day long, which was doubly disappointing as I had read a list of facilities prior to booking that said there was a bar. Rooms were cleaned every day and towels changed. The fridge in our room was never working during our stay although reported as such and the extra pillows we asked for never appeared. We would have preferred a hotel closer to the centre and also better appointed and certainly one with a bar where you could sit and relax with that last drink before retiring for the evening. For these reasons, we would not re-book in future. Mr G Matthews - Broughty Ferry, Dundee
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Funky smell A group of eight of us stayed at the Hotel Select. The rooms were fine but after a heavy rain there was an unbearable musty smell in all the main level rooms. The entire staff, except for Simone were very kind and helpful. Simone seriously needs an attitude adjustment if he is to continue working at the front desk. Florence is a magical city with great sites...stay away from Trattoria del Ponte Vecchio. Their Menu in the front lures you in but surprise its not available after you are seated. The owner offers you the unsuspecting tourist what he wants an charges whatever he feels like...I guess the temptaion is just too great for him.
Reviews.Author: GEMSMOM

Reviews.Content: Nice rooms! My husband and I stayed at the Hotel Select for two nights in July 2005. The hotel was a 20 minute walk from the train station and about 30 minutes walk to the city center. The staff was helpful and professional. Our room (#215) was large and clean and one of the few rooms with a balcony. Because the hotel is further out from the city center, the room and balcony were quiet and it was relaxing. The breakfast is served in a nice room in the basement and includes rolls, cheese, ham, cappuccino and yogurt. There is internet access on one computer in the lobby area for 4 Euro for 30 minutes. The negative to the hotel would be that it is a longer walk to get to the main sights. There are busses running near the hotel, however, we chose to walk while we were in Florence. Overall, it was a positive experience.
Reviews.Author: vacationfan

Reviews.Content: Nice room Hotel has good room, staff is friendly. There is a supermarket and several restaurants close by. We ate at a Cuban restaurnat 3 blocks away and the food was good. Bus line 22 is 3 short blocks away.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Great for the budget if you don't mind the walk As stated by others this is a great value for your money if you don't mind the walk. To get into the city takes about 15-20 minutes walking, but the train station is only about a 10-15 minute walk (with my large pack on my back). They also have a space for cars, however trying to actually arrive there by car was a bit difficult because of all the one way roads. The rooms were clean and the staff extremely helpful and kind. They have a good map to get you into the city and around, but I would suggest stopping at one of the tourist info desk and picking up the map that includes all the public restrooms (WC). They have a breakfast which was decent but could have included fresh fruit. In addition when they ran out of something for the breakfast (even if there was still an hour to go) they did not replenish it. I thought this was a bit odd given that the same thing was served every morning. If you like to run, make your way to the river area and it has great paths there (about a 5-10 minute run away)All in all good value, but it is outside the city center.
Reviews.Author: velureroholt

Reviews.Content: Good Value, Good Exercise! We stayed here for two nights in February, 2005. While it is convenient to the train station, there is not much going on in the neighborhood. However, we certainly got great exercise walking the 10-15 min. walk into town. The bed was kind of hard, but the shower was decent (for Italy standards), and the breakfast was good. I felt we got a decent deal for our money. The best part about this hotel is the service--the front desk was very patient answering all of our questions, and even sold us bus tickets and stamps.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: good value for the money Stayed here for 3 nights in early November, 2004, and found this hotel offered good value for the money. Though fairly far removed from the center of Florence, bus service to the train station was just a short walk for the hotel. Located in a residential neighborhood, there are number of small vendors by the bus stop where you can get your laundry done, buy some groceries and wine (for a picnic lunch), and get a gellato. But no restaurants. So dinner is a bus ride to the train station and into town. The shower in my bathroom was huge and I loved the big fluffy towels. The room comfortable and clean. If street noise bothers you, a word of caution, avoid a room in the front. Staff was friendly, multi-lingual, and very helpful. Can recommend and will consider booking again when I go back to Florence.
Reviews.Author: KahunnaTravel

Reviews.Content: A wonderful hotel I stayed in this hotel when in Florence in December 2003 and again in May 2004. I stayed in 3 and 4 star hotels in Italy on both trips and this was one of my two favourite hotels. The rooms are very nice, clean and well appointed. The staff were very friendly and helpful, providing information, maps, train timetables, bus routes, etc. The hotel is very good value for money. The breakfasts are very good too, with lots of variety. The hotel is about 15 minutes walk to the centre of Florence, but it is just around the corner from a bus stop and it costs Euro 1 to take the bus into the city centre. The bus service is very frequent. It costs around Euro 10 for a taxi to the hotel from the Santa Maria Novella train station in the city centre. I would definitely stay here again.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Too far from the center of town This hotel seemed more like a motel with thin walls. I spent part of a night listening to people in the next room laughing and flushing the toilet. The decor is motel like and you get a tea or coffee service with plastic cups. The bathroom is fine and the breakfast is nice and generous. Also, though we stayed in a nonsmoking room, the hotel in general is very smokey. If you want to see the main sights of Florence, you will be taking lots of cabs or walking many miles. It is not close, but is in a residential neighborhood. Another positive, besides the nice breakfast and clean bathrooms, was that the guy at the front desk was very helpful.
Reviews.Author: Sue8000000

Reviews.Content: Loved the hotel but... Loved the hotel. The service desk was great and very helpful - assisted us in checking train timetables, weather forecasts and museum reservations. The room was beautiful - large, comfortable and clean. The only problem I had was with the distance from the Florence centre (Duomo). It was a fair bit to walk - abt 10-15 minutes which is tiring especially after a day of sightseeing (walking). There is a bus service around the corner (2-3minutes walk) into the centre.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Quiet and Comfortable The Hotel Select was a quiet hotel, in a residential section, 600 meters from the RR station. The room was good for Europe, great shower, plenty of towels, lovely linens on the bed and prints on the wall. The A/C was working and since it was hot for May was a plus after a day of seeing the sights. Breakfast was above average for Europe with delicious crusty rolls, boiled eggs, cheeses, sweet rolls. The only problem was the distance to the center of town. Since we are elderly it was perhaps a larger problem for us. The streets were full of vespas which are very noisy and did detract from the walk. We solved the problem by taking a taxi in the morning to our destination and then walking back to the hotel in the evening.
Reviews.Author: noje
